1001.name: ErrNilClientCode
1001.long_description: Kubernetes config is not initialized with Meshery
1001.probable_cause: Kubernetes config is not accessible to meshery or not valid
1001.suggested_remediation: Upload your kubernetes config via the settings dashboard. If uploaded, wait for a minute for it to get initialized

1003.long_description: Invalid Query performed in Meshery Database

1009.name: ErrSubscribeChannelCode
1009.long_description: Unable to create a broker subscription
1009.probable_cause:
Could be a network issue
Meshery Broker could have crashed
1009.suggested_remediation:
Check if Meshery Broker is reachable from Meshery Server
Check if Meshery Broker is up and running inside the configured cluster

1010.name: ErrPublishBrokerCode
1010.long_description: Unable to create a broker publisher
1010.probable_cause:
Could be a network issue
Meshery Broker could have crashed
1010.suggested_remediation:
Check if Meshery Broker is reachable from Meshery Server
Check if Meshery Broker is up and running inside the configured cluster

1011.name: ErrNoMeshSyncCode

2177.name: ErrCreatingKubernetesComponentsCode
2177.probable_cause:
component generation was canceled due to deletion or reload of K8s context
Invalid kubeconfig
Filters passed incorrectly in config
Could not fetch API resources from Kubernetes server
2177.suggested_remediation:
If there is the log \"Starting to register ...\" for the same contextID after this error means that for some reason the context was reloaded which caused this run to abort. In that case, this error can be ignored.
Make sure that the configuration filters passed are in accordance with output from /openapi/v2
